author: 東森財經
title: 屏東核三驚傳火警！「超濃黑煙狂冒」現場畫面曝
text:
EBC東森財經新聞 屏東核三驚傳火警！「超濃黑煙狂冒」現場畫面曝 閱讀全文
東森財經 2025年3月6日 上午5:59 屏東恆春台電第三核能發電廠今（6）日上午11點半左右傳出火警，現場冒出大量濃煙，目前現場狀況不明，消防隊獲報前往查看，目前發現疑似是冷卻塔故障冒煙，火勢已經控制，至於對核三廠有沒有什麼影響，目前還要再了解。
（封面圖／東森新聞）

author: Matthieu Bonhoure
title: Anglet : le traditionnel bain du Nouvel An annulé à cause des mauvaises conditions météorologiques - France Bleu
text: Anglet : le traditionnel bain du Nouvel An annulé à cause des mauvaises conditions météorologiques LA ville d'Anglet annonce ce vendredi que le traditionnel bain du Nouvel An est annulé ce lundi à cause des mauvaises conditions météorologiques annoncées. C'est une tradition chaque année à Anglet, les courageux se retrouvent pour le bain du Nouvel An dans une eau bien fraîche pour commencer la nouvelle année. Cette année, il n'aura pas lieu à cause des mauvaises conditions météorologiques prévues, c'est la ville d'Anglet qui l'annonce ce vendredi dans un communiqué. Vigilance et prudence Une forte houle est prévue et elle empêche d'assurer le rendez-vous en toute sécurité. La ville d'Anglet invite également les promeneurs qui seraient tentés d'aller marcher au bord à la plus grande prudence. Ma France : quelle école pour demain ? Pédagogie positive, innovations, inclusion, mais aussi drames du harcèlement, sureffectifs ou encore salaire des enseignants… ces sujets qui concernent l’école en France sont au cœur de l’actualité et de l’attention d’une immense majorité de citoyens. Pyrénées-Atlantiques : l'info en continu Pyrénées-Atlantiques : les plus consultés Biarritz : "Je démens formellement ces accusations" de bizutage, réagit le chef étoilé Aurélien Largeau [France Bleu Pays Basque](/pays-basque) Le parquet de Bayonne ouvre une enquête après un bizutage dégradant à l'Hôtel du Palais à Biarritz [France Bleu Pays Basque](/pays-basque) Le Pays basque compte désormais 321.963 habitants, sa croissance ne ralentit pas [France Bleu Pays Basque](/pays-basque)

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Former State High Teacher Charged with Indecent Assault of a Student
text:
By Geoff Rushton ,
2 hours ago
A former State College Area High School Spanish teacher was arrested Thursday on charges that he indecently assaulted a 15-year-old student.
Cesar J. Caceres Tello, 43, of State College, is accused of inappropriately touching and making sexual remarks to the girl while they were alone in a classroom on Dec. 19, 2022.
A police investigation was initiated and Caceres Tello was placed on leave that day, immediately after administrators learned of the incident, a school district spokesperson said. Caceres Tello resigned three days later.
During an interview at the Centre County Children's Advocacy Center, the girl said that after class was dismissed for lunch she was the only student in the room as she remained at her desk briefly to text a friend. Caceres Tello shut the classroom door, closed the blinds and sat at a desk next to her, pulling his chair close to the girl's, according to an affidavit of probable cause filed by State College police.
The girl told investigators her "heart dropped a little bit" and she began thinking "the worst." When Caceres Tello began asking her sexual questions and got "uncomfortably close," she started to cry, according to the affidavit.
Caceres Tello allegedly told the girl she was "too pretty to cry." He then began touching her arms, neck, back and hair and rubbed her thigh through a rip in her jeans, according to the affidavit.
The girl said she she was stunned by the incident and didn't know what to do, remaining in her seat with her legs shaking, police wrote.
When the lunch period ended, Caceres Tello opened the door and the girl immediately went to a bathroom where she informed a friend about what just happened. The friend told police the girl was shaking and at first barely able to speak, according to the affidavit.
The girl decided to hide in the bathroom for the remainder of the class period, and Caceres Tello sent another female student in to look for her, police wrote. On a separate occasion, Caceres Tello allegedly yelled for her from the doorway of the bathroom.
Caceres Tello interrupted the girl's next class to speak with her in the hallway, where he told her "we don't want to start rumors... you know nothing happened" and asked if she was mad at him, according to the affidavit. She told investigators she did not respond and backed away into the classroom.
The teacher of that class noticed the girl appeared to have been crying when she first arrived, police wrote. Caceres Tello interrupting the class to speak with her was "abnormal behavior for a teacher" and the girl appeared more upset when she returned, according to the affidavit.
The teacher asked to speak privately with the girl, who told her the details of the alleged assault, police wrote. The teacher informed high school administrators, who notified the State College police officer assigned to the school.
Video from security cameras and text messages from the girl to two friends "corroborated the victim's account of the assault and the events that followed," according to the affidavit.
Caceres Tello is charged with a felony account of unlawful contact with a minor and misdemeanor counts of corruption of minors and indecent assault.
He was arraigned by District Judge Gregory Koehle, who set unsecured bail at $50,000. A preliminary hearing is scheduled for June 26.
A State College Area School District spokesperson provided the following statement:
"Upon hearing of the incident on Dec. 19, 2022, the district immediately placed Mr. Caceres Tello on administrative leave and he subsequently resigned from the school district on Dec. 22, 2022.
"Student safety is our highest priority, and we are appalled by the deeply disturbing accusations against former teacher Mr. Caceres Tello. When our administration became aware of what a teacher had reported, we took immediate action, which included informing the police and protecting our high school students. Since that time, we have been cooperating with the police during their investigation and also providing support to anyone in need of assistance.
"Nothing is more critical than the trust of our students, employees, and community at-large. Any infringement on that relationship is heartbreaking, and we will do everything we can to repair any harm that has been done. Behavior of this alleged nature violates our core values and will never be tolerated.
"While we cannot discuss any more details during this process, we want to reassure our community that decisive measures have been taken related to this matter. As always, our commitment is to provide a nurturing environment where every student feels safe, respected, and able to reach their full potential. Anything less than that is unacceptable."
The post Former State High Teacher Charged with Indecent Assault of a Student appeared first on StateCollege.com .
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: TV5MONDE
title: Mali: la junte ordonne le retrait de France 2 des bouquets télévisuels
text: [Back to top](#skip-link) La junte malienne ordonne le retrait la chaîne France 2 de tous les bouquets audiovisuels pendant quatre mois Les autorités dominées par les militaires au Mali ont ordonné le retrait de la télévision française France 2 de tous les bouquets audiovisuels pendant quatre mois en raison d'un sujet sur la situation sécuritaire dans le pays, indiquent des documents officiels consultés par l'AFP jeudi. La Haute autorité de la communication reproche au sujet diffusé en janvier par France 2 dans son journal du soir de se livrer à "une apologie du terrorisme" en opposant "la puissance de feu des groupes armés terroristes" à celle des forces armées maliennes. Elle accuse France 2 de tenter de "justifier" rétroactivement par la gravité de la situation actuelle au Mali la présence jusqu'en 2022 de la force antjihadiste française Barkhane. Les forces françaises se sont retirées en 2022 dans un contexte de grave détérioration des relations entre Bamako et Paris après le double coup d'Etat militaire de 2020 et 2021. La junte s'est depuis tournée militairement et politiquement vers la Russie. L'Autorité impute à France 2 de n'avoir rapporté aucun contredit officiel malien. Dans son courrier adressé aux distributeurs, elle parle de "manquements graves" à la déontologie journalistique, visant à "démoraliser les troupes et la population". Contacté par l'AFP, le groupe France Télévisions n'avait pas réagi jeudi soir. Les colonels maliens ont suspendu en 2022 les médias français France 24 et Radio France Internationale, très suivis. Les correspondants d'un certain nombre de médias étrangers ont été contraints au départ, à l'exil ou au silence faute de pouvoir travailler. Des militaires se sont également emparés du pouvoir par la force en 2022 et 2023 au Burkina Faso et au Niger voisins du Mali, et ont pris des mesures contre la presse étrangère. Reporters sans frontières (RSF) écrivait dans un rapport en 2023 que le Sahel menaçait de devenir "la plus grande zone de non-information de l'Afrique".

author: Yahoo Sports
title: PBSO captain's spouse accused of defrauding Medicare with twin brother
text:
Palm Beach Daily News PBSO captain's spouse accused of defrauding Medicare with twin brother Hannah Phillips, Palm Beach Post Updated December 29, 2023 at 12:17 AM · 2 min read Link Copied Read full article
WEST PALM BEACH — Federal prosecutors say the wife and brother-in-law of a high-ranking member of Palm Beach County law enforcement defrauded Medicare out of more than $9 million . If convicted, they could spend up to 55 years in federal prison.
Ted Albin and Erin Foley, South Florida twins and owners of a medical billing company, are accused of conspiring with clients to bill insurers for medical equipment their patients didn't need. In addition to the multimillion dollar payout from insurers, investigators say the twins earned kickbacks for helping others commit fraud, too.
Foley's husband, Randy Foley, leads the Behavioral Services Division at the Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office . He was not named in the 14-page indictment and has not been charged with a crime.
His wife and brother-and-law were indicted in December after investigators identified the siblings' West Palm Beach company, Grapevine Professional Services Inc., as one of several across the country believed to have exploited the federal insurance program.
“Medicare is a valuable taxpayer-funded program, designed to provide affordable health care to people over 65 or with disabilities,” said U.S. Attorney Damian Williams in the wake of their arrest. “Not to line the pockets of those who would enrich themselves through fraud."
' Spine crime': Patients say Lake Worth-area back doctor did 'fake surgeries,' left them in pain
Prosecutors: South Florida twins profited off illegitimate prescriptions Investigators say a network of medical equipment companies provided the twins with sham prescriptions for durable medical equipment, or DME, between 2018 and 2021. DME includes braces, wheelchairs, oxygen equipment and other medical supplies.
The indictment does not name the people who wrote the bogus prescriptions but said Albin and Foley knew of their illegitimate origins and used them to bill insurance companies anyway. The twins owned several medical equipment companies themselves and are accused of funneling their own illegally purchased prescriptions into Grapevine's mix as well.
Investigators believe the pair also charged a fee to connect associates who wanted in on the scam with people willing to sign off on the phony prescriptions.
Foley, 46, of Loxahatchee and Albin, 46, of Stuart were charged in the Southern District of New York with conspiring to commit, and actually committing, health care fraud and wire fraud, as well as conspiring to violate the Anti-Kickback Statute.
Foley's court-appointed defense attorney, Jeffrey Pittell, declined to comment on the allegations Thursday. Albin's attorney, Sean Maher, did not immediately return requests for comment.
Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office spokesperson Teri Barbera said Capt. Randy Foley is a "highly respected member of PBSO and is not implicated in these yet-to-be proven allegations." She declined to comment further.
Hannah Phillips covers criminal justice at The Palm Beach Post. You can reach her at . Help support our journalism and subscribe today .
.
This article originally appeared on Palm Beach Post: South Florida twins accused of defrauding Medicare out of millions
View comments

author: @insideedition
title: Uniformed Police Officers Threw Slushies at Random People, Recorded It | Inside Edition
text: The two officers in the undercover car were identified as Curtis Flynn, 40, and Bryan Wilson, 36. They recorded themselves and shared video with some of their fellow officers. Two [police](https://www.insideedition.com/tag/police) officers were caught throwing drinks at people from unmarked cars. Uniformed police officers patrolling the streets of Louisville, [Kentucky](https://www.insideedition.com/tag/kentucky) recorded themselves throwing slushies at innocent people and shared the [video](https://www.insideedition.com/tag/video) with some of their fellow officers. In one incident, a marked police car followed them and recorded a slushie hitting a pedestrian. It is unclear whether officers in that car were involved. The attacks took place over 11 months in 2018 and 2019, but the video was obtained this week by the Courier Journal Newspaper following a Freedom of Information Act request. Locally the scandal has come to be known as "Slushy-gate." At least 24 innocent people had slushies thrown at them. The two officers in the undercover car were identified as Curtis Flynn, 40, and Bryan Wilson, 36. They were members of an elite undercover drug task force. Both pleaded guilty. Flynn was sentenced to three months and Wilson to 30 months. The accused officers also drove through puddles, drenching people waiting at bus stops. The Mayor of Louisville says the culture of the police department has changed, and incidents like these could not happen again. “We are focused on a very different way of training. We’ve improved focus on supervision. Incidents like that will not be tolerated. Louisville Mayor Craig Greenberg said. Five other officers were disciplined for knowing about the slushy throwing but not reporting it, though they were allowed to stay on the police force.

author: agenda.visit@turismodeportugal.pt
title: Torres Vedras Carnival
text:
Torres Vedras Carnival
Torres Vedras Carnival
Events
Color and joy. Torres Vedras is the perfect destination for those who like Carnival. Here it is celebrated one of the most popular Carnivals in the country.
One of the highlights of the celebration is the parade with floats, men dressed up as women and the giant puppets. The interaction between the public and the masked people is largely done by throwing "cocotes" (small objects made of paper and sawdust and rubber leftovers) between them.
On Saturday night all masked groups participate in the party of masked groups. The music is also local and tries to keep the Portuguese roots.
This Carnival is held right in the center of town.

author: queenseyes
title: 10th Annual Sausage Fest @ Rusty Nickel Brewing - Buffalo Rising
text:
On Saturday, January 25, Rusty Nickel Brewing will host its 10th Annual Sausage Fest (1pm – 11pm). The event is considered a “must attend” event for amateur sausage makers, and food lovers alike. This year’s event will feature:
- Live music and entertainment
- Outdoor campfires
- Food and drink specials
- Mini meat raffles
- The sausage toss game
- A homemade sausage competition
- Prizes from the event Sausage Sponsor Wardynski’s
- Special event food menus thanks to food sponsors Wardynski’s Meats, Costanzo’s Bakery, Redlinski Meats, Hanzlian’s Sausage, Strobel Farms, and US Foods
“The day is centered around a home-made sausage competition, which is free to enter and includes a complimentary beverage for the cook. Competitors ‘compete with their meat’ at a chance to win the one and only Sausage Fest Trophy for Best in Show. Additional prizes are courtesy of our premier sponsor The Sausage Maker. There are three competition categories including Breakfast, Wild Game, and Traditional Sausage. All entries qualify for the coveted Best In Show Trophy! Register your sausage here!” – Rusty Nickel Brewing Co.
The free event is open to the public.
For all the up-to-date information and announcements, visit rustynickelbrewing.com.
Rusty Nickel Brewing 4350 Seneca St, West Seneca, NY 14224

author: 网易
title: 上市公司"AI+"迸发创新火花 技术革命催生新增长曲线|江涛|人工智能|科大讯飞|知名企业_网易订阅
text:
以语音交互系统助力汽车出海。 陈雨康/摄
证券时报记者 陈雨康
人工智能（AI）是新一轮科技革命和产业变革的重要驱动力量。2025年《政府工作报告》提出，“持续推进‘人工智能+’行动，将数字技术与制造优势、市场优势更好结合起来，支持大模型广泛应用”。记者近日在采访中了解到，在“AI+”上，上市公司已走在了前列，全流程、多场景的“AI+”已深深植入上市公司的经营日常、产品及服务。展望未来，在推进“人工智能+”行动的过程中，资本市场在培育新质生产力、促进科技创新和产业创新深度融合等方面可以发挥更加积极的作用。
上市公司“AI+”迸发创新火花
通过国家临床执业医师考试笔试、以语音交互系统助力汽车出海、在知识图谱动态路径规划赛中获得冠军……走进科大讯飞展厅，该公司通过AI大模型赋能医疗、汽车、教育等垂直领域的成果栩栩如生地展示在大屏幕上。工作人员表示，科大讯飞所有的产品都体现公司“顶天立地”的战略。
科大讯飞联合创始人、副总裁江涛在深交所第22期“创享荟”期间对证券时报记者表示，所谓“顶天”，就是让人工智能核心技术对标国际最新水平；“立地”则是要将这些成果规模化落地，赋能千行百业，走进千家万户。以医疗为例，科大讯飞智医助理早在2017年就通过了国家医师资格考试，目前其准确率已超过99.9%。该技术已在600多个区县的基层医院得到应用，帮助医生减少诊断和处方错误，累计服务超过9亿人次，避免了160多万个可能引发医疗事故的错误。
“未来，科大讯飞将进一步推动人工智能在医院的应用，它不仅能辅助医生解决复杂问题，还将在诊后随访和患者健康管理方面发挥更大作用。”江涛说，未来，科大讯飞将进一步促进具身智能的发展，让人工智能在物理世界中具备感知、认知、决策和执行能力，最终进入家庭，提供如端茶送水、亲情陪伴、照顾老人和辅导孩子学习等服务。美的集团AI语言专家高羽表示：“公司在AI领域也有诸多投入和尝试，期待与深交所以及其他优秀企业携手，共同开拓AI在各行业的应用，将AI转化为企业高质量发展的新动力。”
从清晨窗帘自动透进阳光，到晚间电器自动“待命”，智能家居已不再是科幻电影中才有的场景。在众多领先的智能家居系统中，AI如同隐形的“大脑”始终运筹帷幄。高羽在接受证券时报记者采访时表示，生成式AI大模型为家居产业链带来了重大变化，尤其在产品交互和生产制造上。例如，美的空调可以理解类似“我想睡一个舒服的觉”的模糊指令，将模糊需求转化为具体的设备控制指令，这得益于美的自研的大模型和推理模型。在公司运营中，美的集团内部生成式AI平台去年上线，据统计，为公司节约了超1.6亿元成本，并提升工作效率达300多万小时。
高羽表示，未来3年，美的将围绕“AI+”在三个领域重点布局。在智能家居上，重点发展家庭智能体，让家电从被动服务转变为能理解用户习惯的主动服务，并实现多个设备间的自主协同。在工厂智能体上，将让AI技术融入到工业制造中，实现AI优化生产线、智能预测故障并提前检测、帮助生成工业设计图、根据订单需求自动排产补货等。此外，美的正在推广AIGC开发者平台，旨在降低AI技术的使用门槛。无论是专业开发人员还是普通员工，都可以通过上传数据获得定制化的智能体。
随着智能网联汽车快速兴起，传统汽车产业面临着生死存亡的考验。长安汽车座舱AI总师罗咏刚喊出“无AI不长安”的口号。罗咏刚对证券时报记者表示，今年前3个月，公司在办公、开发、测试等全环节进行了AI智能体重构，力争用AI提升工作效率。在汽车产品端，公司着眼于“交互式智驾”“整车AI”，通过搭载大模型等方式，利用AI全面重塑汽车的功能形态和技术架构。此外，公司还在积极构建专门的AI团队。
“我们希望打通驾驶、座舱及外部生态，实现车的完全智慧化，甚至超越人的理解。例如：用户说‘我头晕’，车能自动开窗、靠边停车供用户休息。”罗咏刚表示。
耐心资本助力AI赋能千行百业
2025年《政府工作报告》明确提出“加快发展创业投资，壮大耐心资本”。近年来，以政府产业基金为代表的耐心资本，通过长期战略指导、资源对接、容错机制等探索，为新兴产业企业搭建起“资金+技术+场景”的良性循环，在AI产业发展中发挥着“四两拨千斤”的作用。在全国各地的实践中，合肥无疑是耐心资本的佼佼者。
合肥产投集团（以下简称“合肥产投”）资本运营部副总经理李赵劼在接受证券时报记者采访时表示，AI是智力密集型和资金密集型行业，需要大量资源和资金投入。对此，合肥产投从早期到后期都有布局：早期设立政策性孵化基金，帮助初创AI企业解决算法、算力和数据等问题；中期和后期则通过市场化的VC和PE资金，扶持通用模型或多模态AI企业。合肥产投尤其强调长期陪伴和耐心资本，覆盖企业全生命周期。
“目前AI商业化闭环尚未完全形成，企业经营性现金流多为流出。作为产业资本，我们从产业链和生态端两方面赋能。”李赵劼介绍，一方面，合肥产投在人工智能产业链上布局，投资异构计算、模型标注、算法调校等企业，还参与政府相关配套基础设施投建，间接降低AI企业成本；另一方面，在生态端，合肥产投将AI技术导入到其他产业，如生物医药研发，帮助AI企业创造商业化订单。
记者注意到，安徽省已设有十大产业主题母基金，其中就包括人工智能母基金。合肥产投组建人工智能相关基金，重点扶持通用大模型、垂类模型和多模态企业，并提供场景落地对接和新型研发机构的科技成果转化服务。
“目前，合肥产投管理的基金规模实缴已近400亿元，涵盖九大战略性新兴产业。其中，AI是重点领域，其与先进制造、智能计算、新能源等产业有交叉和重合。”李赵劼说。
过去几年，资本市场在推动AI赋能千行百业上发挥着越来越突出的作用。一方面，政府引导基金、市场化机构等创投力量，通过风险容忍机制支持硬科技研发，加速“AI+”技术迭代与产业链集聚。另一方面，IPO为AI企业提供直接融资关键渠道，并购重组等资本手段持续优化AI产业资源配置，资本市场的价值发现功能也有利于营造良好的创新生态。
江涛对证券时报记者表示，中国资本市场在赋能AI科技创新方面正扮演着关键角色；不过，与更为成熟的资本市场相比，仍存在诸多提升空间。例如，美国已经构建了一套从高校实验室到硅谷，再到华尔街的完整创新体系，相关经验值得借鉴。
“一方面，建议我国资本市场以更具灵活性的政策来适应人工智能产业的快速发展需求；另一方面，从实验室到上市公司的创新体系亟待进一步建设和完善。我国资本市场需形成从基础研究到应用开发，再到商业化的完整链条，并打造资金、人才和产业的良性循环。”江涛表示，优化估值体系也是当务之急。当前中国资本市场对人工智能企业的估值相对较低，未能充分反映真正的价值。资本市场还需要优化估值体系，充分考虑人工智能企业的技术潜力、市场前景和创新能力等因素，给予更合理的估值。
“AI+”道阻且长
依托技术的自主可控、海量的数据积累、丰富的应用场景等优势，中国AI产业已来到全球科技竞争的“第一梯队”。多名业内人士表示，未来，AI在产业链协同、应用创新等领域大有可为，“AI+”将勾勒更加亮丽的增长曲线。不过，高端芯片、基础研究、产融结合等领域仍是中国AI产业的突出短板。业内普遍认为，中国AI产业发展道阻且长，仍需借鉴国际先进经验，筑牢并扩大先发优势。
分众传媒副总裁宁玉杰在深交所第22期“创享荟”期间对证券时报记者表示，国产AI的核心竞争力表现在成本优势、应用场景丰富、数据和经验积累等方面，但基础理论研发能力不足、技术普及和推广不足等短板也不容忽视。
在爱尔眼科信息中心总监唐凡看来，从全链条强化自主算力建设迫在眉睫。“借力国产算力，是爱尔眼科下一阶段AI算力建设的重点研究方向。随着爱尔眼科‘AI+’应用场景的扩大，算力需求可能会急剧上升，我们正在积极评估采用云化方式进行算力的弹性扩张，以规避算力闲置和资源浪费。”唐凡对记者说。
江涛认为，国产AI的商业化路径要“独辟蹊径”。不同于美国通过云服务SaaS模式直接收费，中国软件服务往往不太叫座，而比较优势在于强大的制造业和消费者对实体产品的偏好。预计未来中国人工智能商业化将更依赖与制造业的结合，将技术落地为实体产品。
江涛还表示，要理性看待中国在人工智能领域的不足。以基础理论研究为例，过去20多年人工智能重大里程碑式的论文多由西方人发表，中国在基础研究上相对薄弱。此外，美国从高校实验室到硅谷，再到华尔街的产融创新体系也睥睨全球，中国AI产业还需要在基础研究、产融结合上持续发力。
